qas.question: When was the organ first used?

answers.text: the coronation of King George VI

qas.question: What was included in the new organ from the previous Hill organ of 1848?
Who designed the two organ cases?
When was the organ last used?
What was included in the new organ from the previous Hill organ of 1948?
Who designed the three organ cases?

context: The organ was built by <a0_0><b5_0>Harrison & Harrison<b5_0/><a0_0/> in <a1_0><b6_0>1937<b6_0/><a1_0/>, then with four manuals and 84 speaking stops, and was used for the first time at <a2_0>the coronation of <b7_0>King George VI<b7_0/><a2_0/>. Some <a3_0><b8_0>pipework<b8_0/><a3_0/> from the previous Hill organ of 1848 was revoiced and incorporated in the new scheme. The two organ cases, designed in the late 19th century by <a4_0><b9_0>John Loughborough Pearson<b9_0/><a4_0/>, were re-instated and coloured in 1959.
